command.name: addUser-s
command.short-description: Command to quickly add a user, you need write just a login and password,the rest of the information will be generated.
command.long-description:
[Description] Command to quickly add a user, you need write just a login and password, the rest of the information will be generated.
[Construction] addUser-s {login} {password}
{login} -> string | text {password} -> string | text
for example. addUsers-s admin 1234

command.name: addUser-r
command.short-description: Command to quickly add a user or huge amount of users which then all datas will be generated.
command.long-description:
[Description] Command to quickly add a user or huge amount of users.
[Construction] addUser-r {amount of users}
{amount of users} -> int | Argument is not necessarily, without that developer tool will create 1 user.
for example. addUsers-s 1, addUsers-s or addUsers-s 874

command.name: addUser-a
command.short-description: Command to add a user where all user parameters must be provided.
command.long-description:
[Description] Command to add a user where all user parameters must be provided.
[Construction] addUser-a '{login}' '{password}' '{name}' '{surname}' '{email}' '{position}' '{hierarchy}' '{canAddUser}' '{canDeleteUser}' '{canEditUser}'
{login} -> string | 'text' {password} -> string | 'text' {name} -> string | 'text' {surname} -> string | 'text' {email} -> string | 'text' {position} -> string | 'text' {hierarchy} -> int | 'number' {canAddUser} -> bool | 'true' or 'false' {canDeleteUser} -> bool | 'true' or 'false' {canEditUser} -> bool | 'true' or 'false'
To add an argument, you must enter it between '{argument}' characters.
for example. addUsers-a 'login' 'password' 'name' 'surname' 'email' 'position' '5' 'true' 'false' 'true'
